verbs.description: displant (third-person singular simple present displants, present participle displanting, simple past and past participle displanted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To remove anything from where it has been planted or placed; to drive a person from their home.
examples: But the Ships, in which this second Colony was transported, had not been many Days returned into England, before we find Ralegh’s Thoughts diverted, for a while, from planting in a foreign Country, and engaged upon Schemes of displanting rather those powerful Enemies who were preparing to root themselves in his own.
